newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Welback says stake sale talks ended.
newsitem.headline: Welback says stake sale talks ended.

text.p: Welback Holdings Ltd's chairman Lee Chun Kwok and managing director Fong Wing Seng had terminated talk with a third party on a possible sale their company shares, the video game maker said on Wednesday.

"They have not reached any agreement with the independent third party...in relation to a possible acquisition of the company's shares held by them and they have stopped further negotiation with the said independent third party," Welback said in a statement.
Welback said earlier this week that Lee and Fong were still in talks to sell their stake in the company.
Lee and Fong hold an aggregate 140.84 million shares or 59.05 percent of Welback.
